event.doc_name: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: First, following the release of the 2020 decennial Census data, the Legislature waited months to pass any maps at all, depriving voters of the ability to know which candidates would represent them and organize accordingly.
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Legislature delayed redistricting after 2020 Census data release, depriving voters of knowing their representatives and organizing accordingly

evidence.text: Next and consistent with previous redistricting cycles, the Legislature enacted a racially gerrymandered congressional map that also intentionally discriminates against Black voters. It did so by ignoring the many South Carolinians who implored lawmakers to draw fair and nondiscriminatory maps that comply with the U.S. Constitution when redrawing congressional and state legislative maps.
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Racially gerrymandered congressional map enacted that intentionally discriminates against Black voters by packing and cracking Black voters across districts

evidence.text: One of many examples, an 1892 South Carolina voter registration law 'is estimated to have disfranchised 75 percent of South Carolina’s [B]lack voters.'
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Historical pattern of racial discrimination in South Carolina voting rights including 1892 voter registration law disenfranchising 75% of Black voters

evidence.text: S. 865 enacted racially gerrymandered congressional districts into law and was motivated, at least in part, by a discriminatory purpose. It is the latest example of a decades-long pattern by the Legislature of proposing or enacting congressional districts that discriminate against Black South Carolinian voters to limit their electoral opportunity.
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Post-2020 redistricting cycle continued decades-long pattern of racial discrimination with Congress enacting S. 865 to dilute Black voting strength
